page.title: 18Interview with Mrs Allen
page.content: I interviewed a housewife to find out the major changes in the area in the past 30 years.She thought that of great loss to the area was the closure of its railway branch line,first to passengers in 1952,then freight in 1963.An improvement to communications came with the opening of the A303 dual carriageway in 1969, by-passing Amesbury and protecting its streets from the ever increasing traffic. The population of Amesbury has more than trebled in 30 years as a result of the Military presence.An extension to the existing Council housing estate was completed in 1974.The Secondary Modern School turned Comprehensive in 1978.A number of small industries have developed some geared to the Leisure industry but the major employers remain the Naafi and Ministry of Defence.
